elements.name: PLTQ1
elements.title: You are suing as...
elements.description: The person/entity that is bringing a claim should be the one directly involved in the dispute. For example they have suffered damages, is owed a debt or is party to a contract dispute.

elements.name: PLTQ2
elements.title: Are you 19 years of age or older?

elements.name: PLTQ3
elements.title: Do you have a litigation guardian to act on your behalf?
elements.description: If you are under 19 years of age, you must start the claim through an adult who lives in BC and is willing to act as your litigation guardian. This person must file at the registry a signed consent to act as litigation guardian and certificate of fitness.

elements.name: PLTQ3Help1
elements.title: What if I can't find an adult to act as my litigation guardian?
elements.body: Contact the child and youth services section of the Public Guardian and Trustee. You may contact their office by phone at 604 660-4444 or 1-800-663- 7867 or by email at mail@trustee.bc.ca

elements.name: PLTQ3Define1
elements.title: A litigation guardian is an adult who lives in BC and is willing to act on your behalf in legal matters. This person must file at the registry a signed consent to act as litigation guardian and certificate of fitness.

elements.name: PLTQ3End
elements.title: You must have a litigation guardian to act on your behalf. If you are unable to get one contact the child and youth services section of the Public Guardian and Trustee. You may contact their office by phone at 604 660-4444 or 1-800-663- 7867 or by email at mail@trustee.bc.ca

elements.name: LGClaimant
elements.title: What is the name of your litigation guardian?

elements.name: Claimant1
elements.title: What is your full name?
elements.description: Please include your full legal name. For example, how it appears on your passport or government issued identification.

elements.name: PLTQ7
elements.title: Has a lawyer agreed to receive documents on your behalf?
elements.description: If you have retained a lawyer to be the lawyer on record they will usually receive documents for you. If you are unsure it is best to clarify with them.

elements.name: ClaimantComp
elements.title: What is the registered name of the company making the claim?

elements.name: PLTQ5Help1
elements.title: How do I find out the registered name?
elements.body: To get the correct name and address of the registered office, you must request a company search. For information about obtaining a company search, please visit the Government of BC website for Requesting Searches & Certificates” (https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/employment-business/business/managing-a-business/permits-licences/businesses-incorporated-companies/searches-certificates)

elements.name: PLTPanelQ9
CAddress
elements.title: What is the address where you can receive court documents?
elements.description: This is the address where the court and other parties will send documents and notifications to you. If your address changes at any time, be sure to notify the court and all other parties to the lawsuit. To do this, use the Notice of Address form (Link to form).

elements.name: PLTQ9Help1
elements.title: Do I need to provide my home address?
elements.body: No, the address does not need to be to your home, so long as you are able to receive documents at the address provided. For example, it can be a work address.

elements.name: PLTQ9Help2
elements.title: What address do I give for a company or society?
elements.body: If the company is incorporated you must provide the registered office as the address. In some cases this may be a different address than where business is carried out. For a society use the address of the society's registered office on file with the Registrar of Companies.

elements.name: PLTQ10
elements.title: Fax Number
elements.description: Only include a fax number if you are OK with receiving court documents via fax.

elements.name: PLTQ11
elements.title: Email Address
elements.description: Only include an email if you are OK with receiving court documents via email

elements.visibleIf: {PLTQ1} = "PLTQ1B" or ({PLTQ1} = "PLTQ1A" and {PLTQ2} = "y" and {PLTQ7} = "n") or ({PLTQ1} = "PLTQ1A" and {PLTQ2} = "n" and {PLTQ3} = "y" and {PLTQ7} = "n")

elements.name: CLAddress
elements.title: What is the lawyers address where they can receive documents?
elements.description: This will usually be the address of their firm.

elements.name: CLContact
elements.title: Contact Information

elements.name: PLTQ12
elements.title: What is your occupation?
elements.description: For example, web designer, accountant, nurse, student, waiter, etc.

elements.name: NOCCFilterQ2
elements.title: What area does your dispute involve?

elements.name: NOCCFilterContinue
elements.title: Continue

elements.name: DIQ1
elements.title: Do you wish to sue a single person or entity?
elements.description: If you are unsure who to name as a defendant you should seek legal advice.

elements.name: DIQ1Define1
elements.title: Entities include companies, businesses, partnerships, societies, agencies and governments.

elements.name: DIQ1End
elements.title: I'm afraid at this time this tool is only available for single party defendant lawsuits. If you wish to name multiple defendants you will need to fill out the court forms here:

elements.name: DIQ2
elements.title: You are suing...

elements.name: DIQ2Help1
elements.title: How do I know if it's an incorporated company?
elements.body: Usually the name of an incorporated company ends with Limited (Ltd.), Corporation (Corp.) or Incorporated (Inc.) If you are unsure it is best to do a company search.

elements.name: DIQ2Help2
elements.title: What if the person I am suing is under 19 years old?
elements.body: If the defendant is under the age of 19 their legal guardian will need to be served with the Notice of Civil Claim.

elements.name: DIQ3
elements.title: What is the full name of the person you are suing?
elements.description: Use their full name. Do not use initials, titles or brackets. If the person has goes by two different names you can use also known as. For example Samantha Lee also known as Samantha McGregory.

elements.name: DIQ4
elements.title: What is the name of the business you are suing?

elements.name: DIQ5
elements.title: What is the registered name of the incorporated company you are suing?

elements.name: DIQ5Help1
elements.title: How do I find out the registered name?
elements.body: To get the correct name and address of the registered office, you must request a company search. For information about obtaining a company search, please visit the Government of BC website for Requesting Searches & Certificates” (https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/employment-business/business/managing-a-business/permits-licences/businesses-incorporated-companies/searches-certificates)

elements.name: DIQ6
elements.title: What is the name of the partnership you are suing?

elements.name: DIQ7
elements.title: What is the name of the society you are suing?

elements.name: DIQ8
elements.title: What is the name of the entity you are suing?

elements.name: DIQ9A
elements.title: What is [Defendant 1] 's address?
elements.description: This is the address where they can receive court documents and notifications. If they are an incorporated company this will be the registered address you can find after doing a corporate search. For information on how to do a corporate search see___

elements.name: DIQ9B
elements.title: Contact Information

elements.name: DIQ9Help1
elements.title: What if I can't find the defendant's address?
elements.body: If you have been unable to find out the address of the defendant on your own you may consider higher a private investigator firm.

elements.name: DIQ9Help2
elements.title: How do I find out the registered office address?
elements.body: To get the correct name and address of the registered office, you must request a company search. For information about obtaining a company search, please visit the Government of BC website for Requesting Searches & Certificates” (https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/employment-business/business/managing-a-business/permits-licences/businesses-incorporated-companies/searches-certificates)

elements.name: DIContinue
elements.title: Continue

elements.name: NGQ2
elements.title: What is your relationship with the defendant?

elements.name: NGQ3
elements.title: Describe the relevant facts of your dispute.

elements.name: NGQ4
elements.title: What remedy are you asking for from the courts?

elements.name: NGQ5
elements.title: What is your legal bases? (e.g. laws, specific court rules etc.)

elements.name: NGQ6
elements.title: What courthouse location are you filing this claim?

elements.name: NAQ1
elements.title: Who are you?

elements.name: NAQ1Define1
elements.title: Plaintiff is the person or entity that started the lawsuit. They are the one making the claim.

elements.name: NAQ1Define2
elements.title: The Defendant is the one being sued. They are named as the defendant on the Notice of Civil Claim.

elements.name: NAQ2
elements.title: What is your full legal name?
elements.description: For example, how it appears on your passport or government issued identification.

elements.name: NAQ3
elements.title: Name all the people or parties affected by this application
elements.description: This usually includes the defendant and plaintiff and the person the order relates to. For example if you are seeking an order for the plaintiff's medical records held by Dr. Smith, you would want to name both the plaintiff and Dr. Smith.

elements.name: NAQ4
elements.title: Please choose the courthouse you wish to make your application at:

choices.text: dropdown menu of all supreme courthouses in bc

elements.name: NAQ5
elements.title: When will you appear before the court to make this application?

elements.name: NAQ5A
elements.title: How long do you expect this application to take?

elements.name: NAQ6
elements.title: What order are you asking the court to make?
elements.description: If you are asking for multiple orders use separate numbered paragraphs for each. Specify who the order is against.

elements.name: NAQ7
elements.title: Give a brief summary of facts supporting this application:
elements.description: Use numbered paragraphs to organize your facts. Try to use a new paragraph for each new fact.

elements.name: NAQ8
elements.title: What laws or rules are you relying on to support your application?

elements.name: NAQ9
elements.title: Are you relying on any 'affidavits' to support your application?

elements.name: NAPanelQ10
NAQ10Number
elements.title: Affidavit #

elements.name: NAQ10Name
elements.title: Name

elements.name: NAQ10Date
elements.title: Date
Please provide the following information about the `affidavit`:
elements.description: This information can usually be found on the top right hand corner of the `affidavit`.

elements.name: NAQ11
elements.title: Are you relying on any other documents already in the court file to support your application?

elements.name: NAQ12
elements.title: Please describe this document:

elements.name: NAQ13
elements.title: Please select all that apply: This application involves:

elements.name: NAComplete
elements.title: Complete

elements.name: NCQ1
elements.title: Did you have a contract or agreement with the defendant?
elements.description: Agreement can be a verbal agreement. For example the plumber agreed to fix my kitchen pipes for $50,000.

elements.name: NCQ1End
elements.title: END

elements.name: NCQ2
elements.title: Is your contract/agreement in writing?

elements.name: NCQ3
elements.title: Did you sign your contract?

elements.name: NCQ4
elements.title: What date did you sign your contract?
elements.description: If you're not sure of the exact date give the approximate date as best you can.

elements.name: NCQ5
elements.title: When did you make this contract/agreement?
elements.description: If you're not sure of the exact date give the approximate date as best you can.

elements.name: NCQ6Container
NCQ6City
elements.title: City

elements.name: NCQ6Prov
elements.title: Province
Where did you make the contract/agreement?

elements.name: NCQ7
elements.title: Briefly describe the nature of the contract/agreement:
elements.description: For example: The defendant agreed to hire the claimant as a project manager for the XYZ project for a period of 6 months starting October 2018.

elements.name: NCQ8
elements.title: Which situation best describes your dispute:

choices.text: You and [Defendant1] disagree about the term(s) in the contract
You and the defendant disagree about the validity of the contract
The defendant has in your view not fulfilled their obligations under the contract

elements.name: NCQ9
elements.title: Describe the disagreement over the term in the contract:

elements.name: NCQ10
elements.title: Describe your disagreement:

elements.name: NCQ11
elements.title: Describe the obligation under the contract that the defendant has not fulfilled and how it has not been fulfilled:

elements.name: NCQ14
elements.title: Please describe the issue:

elements.name: NCQ12
elements.title: Have you requested that [defendant] fulfill their obligation?

elements.name: NCQ13
elements.title: When did you make this request?

elements.name: NCQ15
elements.title: Have you incurred any damages because of the contract dispute?

elements.name: NCQ15Define1
elements.title: Damages or costs are the impact you have suffered as a result of the defendant's wrong doing.  For example if someone injured you your damages might include medical bills or lost income.

elements.name: NCQ16
elements.title: Please describe these damages:
elements.description: For example, because of the contract, I turned down another employment opportunity and thereby financially suffered.

elements.name: NCQ17
elements.title: Please provide any other relevant facts you wish the court to know.

elements.name: NCQ18
elements.title: What remedy are you asking for from the courts?

elements.name: NCQ19
elements.title: What is your legal bases? (e.g. laws, specific court rules etc.)?

elements.name: NCQ20
elements.title: What courthouse location are you filing this claim?

elements.name: NCComplete
elements.title: Complete

elements.name: NDQ1
elements.title: Is money owed to you by [Defendant1]?

elements.name: NDQ1End
elements.title: END

elements.name: NDQ2
elements.title: [Defendant1] owes you money for:

elements.name: NSQ2Define1
elements.title: Services would include work done by one person for another. For example, being hired to paint someone's house or to give them swimming lessons.

elements.name: NDQ2Define2
elements.title: Goods would include items such as a car, a TV or furniture. Animals are considered goods.

elements.name: NDQ3
elements.title: Were the services you provided at the request of [defendant]?

elements.name: NDPanelQ5
elements.title: Briefly describe the service you provided:
elements.description: For example, I was hired by the defendant to reroof their home. I rendered these services but have not been paid fully for them.

elements.name: NDQ6
elements.title: When did you provide the service?

elements.name: NDQ7
elements.title: Where did you provide the service?

elements.name: NDQ6Q1
elements.title: What if I don't know the exact location?
elements.body: If you do not know the exact location, you may right "around". For example, "around 29th avenue and main street."

elements.name: NDQ15
elements.title: Did you agree on the price for the service?

elements.name: NDQ16
elements.title: What price?

elements.name: ADQ7
elements.title: How much did you loan to [Defendant1]?
elements.description: Describe the amount that was to be paid, when and how it was to be paid. Include any other relevant details about the agreed upon payment.

elements.name: NDQ7Q1
elements.title: What if we didn't agree on a price?
elements.body: If no set price was decided on describe how the service or goods was to be paid. For example, you provided an estimate price of $6000 for the repairs but agreed that the final price would be determined once work was completed. You did a final price assessment on October 25, 2017 and sent a the final invoice for $7000 to the Defendant.

elements.name: NDQ8
elements.title: When did you give [Defendant1] this loan?

elements.name: NDQ10
elements.title: Where did you give [Defendant1] the loan?

elements.name: NDQ10Q1
elements.title: What if I don't know the exact location?
elements.body: If you do not know the exact location, you may right "around".

elements.name: NDQ32
elements.title: Did you agree on a date the loan was to be repaid?

elements.name: NDQ11
elements.title: When was the loan to be repaid?

elements.name: NDQ12
elements.title: Was there an agreed upon interest rate on the loan?

elements.name: NDQ13
elements.title: Please provide the details of the interest rate:

elements.name: NDQ14
elements.title: Describe any other relevant terms of the loan:
elements.description: Describe the amount that was to be paid, when and how it was to be paid. Include any other relevant details about the agreed upon payment.

elements.name: NDQ14Q1
elements.title: What if we didn't agree on a price?
elements.body: If no set price was decided on describe how the service or goods was to be paid. For example, you provided an estimate price of $6000 for the repairs but agreed that the final price would be determined once work was completed. You did a final price assessment on October 25, 2017 and sent a the final invoice for $7000 to the Defendant.

elements.name: NDQ33
elements.title: Did [defendant] fail to meet the terms of the loan?
elements.description: In other words are there terms you both agreed to that the other party is not following?

elements.name: NDQ22
elements.title: Explain:

elements.name: NDQ17
elements.title: Briefly describe the goods you sold to [Defendant1]:
elements.description: For example, I sold to the Defendant a 2015 Toyota Yaris.

elements.name: NDQ18
elements.title: When did you provide these goods?

elements.name: NDQ19
elements.title: Where did you provide these goods?

elements.name: NDQ19Q1
elements.title: What if I don't know the exact location?
elements.body: If you do not know the exact location, you may right "around".

elements.name: NDQ20
elements.title: Did you agree on a price for the goods?

elements.name: NDQ21
elements.title: What price?

elements.name: NDPanelQ23
NDQ23
elements.title: Did [Defendant1] partially pay you?

elements.name: NDQ24
elements.title: How much did [Defendant1] partially pay you?
elements.description: Describe the amount that was paid and any other relevant details about the payment.

elements.name: NDQ24Q1
elements.title: What if we didn't agree on a price?
elements.body: If no set price was decided on describe how the service or goods was to be paid. For example, you provided an estimate price of $6000 for the repairs but agreed that the final price would be determined once work was completed. You did a final price assessment on October 25, 2017 and sent a the final invoice for $7000 to the Defendant.

elements.name: NDQ25
elements.title: When did [Defendant1] make this payment to you?

elements.visibleIf: ({NDQ2} = "NDQ2A" and {NDQ15} notempty) or ({NDQ2} = "NDQ2C" and {NDQ20} notempty) or ({NDQ2} = "NDQ2B" and {NDQ33} = "y")

elements.name: NDPanelQ26
NDQ26
elements.title: How much does [defendant]  still owe you?

elements.name: NDQ27
elements.title: Have you made demands of [Defendant1] to repay you?

elements.name: NDQ28
elements.title: Please provide any other relevant facts you wish the court to know.

elements.name: NDQ29
elements.title: What remedy are you asking for from the courts?

elements.name: NDQ30
elements.title: What is your legal bases? (e.g. laws, specific court rules etc.)?

elements.name: NDQ31
elements.title: What courthouse location are you filing this claim?

elements.name: NDComplete
elements.title: Complete

elements.visibleIf: (({NDQ2} = "NDQ2A" and {NDQ15} notempty) or ({NDQ2} = "NDQ2C" and {NDQ20} notempty) or ({NDQ2} = "NDQ2B" and {NDQ33} = "y") and {NDQ23} notempty) or ({NDQ2} = "NDQ2B" and {NDQ33} = "n")

elements.name: NMQ1
elements.title: Were you involved in a car accident?

elements.name: NMQ1End
elements.title: END

elements.name: NMQ4
elements.title: You were:

choices.text: Driving a car involved in the accident
A passenger of a car involved in the accident
A cyclist involved in the accident
A pedestrian involved in the accident

elements.name: NMQ9
elements.title: Where did the accident take place?

elements.name: NMQ10
elements.title: When did the accident occur?

elements.name: NMQ11
elements.title: [Defendant1] is:

choices.text: The driver of the other car
The driver of the car you were in
A cyclist involved in the accident

elements.name: NMQ15
elements.title: The defendant is the driver and owner of the vehicle involved in the accident?

elements.name: NMQ17
elements.title: At this time this application is only for claims with a single defendant. Do you wish to proceed with this application?

elements.name: NMQ17End
elements.title: END

elements.name: NMPanelQ19
NMQ19
elements.title: Please briefly describe the accident:
elements.description: Provide information on what direction the people involved in the accident were traveling and how the accident occurred. For example: the plaintiff was travelling south in the inside lane on Main Street. When the plaintiff approached the intersection of Main Street and 15th Avenue, the defendant, proceeding east on 15th Avenue, made a left-hand turn onto Main Street, without signal or warning to the plaintiff, in front of the plaintiff’s motor vehicle.

elements.name: NMQ20
elements.title: Was the collision caused or contributed to by the negligence of the defendant?

elements.name: NMQ22
elements.title: What cause are you claiming?

elements.name: NMQ25
elements.title: Choose all that apply. You are claiming judgement against the defendant for:

choices.text: General damages for pain, suffering, loss of amenities, and loss of enjoyment of life
Damages for past lost income and loss of opportunity to earn income
Damages for future loss of income and future earning capacity
Damages for future cost of care
Damages for loss of house maintenance capacity
Other relief as the judge decides is fair

elements.name: NMQ36
elements.title: Legal basis:

elements.name: NMComplete
elements.title: Complete

elements.visibleIf: {NMQ11} = "NMQ11C" or {NMQ11} = "NMQ11D"  or ({NMQ11} = "NMQ11A" and {NMQ15} = "y") or ({NMQ11} = "NMQ11B" and {NMQ15} = "y") or ({NMQ11} = "NMQ11A" and {NMQ15} = "n" and {NMQ17} = "y") or ({NMQ11} = "NMQ11B" and {NMQ15} = "n" and {NMQ17} = "y")

elements.name: MTQ1
elements.title: Were you involved in a motor vehicle accident?

elements.name: MTQ1End
elements.title: END

elements.name: MTQ2
elements.title: You were...

choices.text: Driving a vehicle involved in the accident
A passenger of a vehicle involved in the accident
A cyclist involved in the accident
A pedestrian involved in the accident

elements.name: MTQ3
elements.title: Where did the accident take place?

elements.name: MTQ4
elements.title: When did the accident occur?

elements.name: MTQ5
elements.title: [Defendant1] is...

choices.text: The driver of the other vehicle
The driver of the vehicle you were in
A cyclist involved in the accident

elements.name: MTQ6
elements.title: Single defendant?

elements.name: MTQ6End
elements.title: END

elements.name: MTQ7
elements.title: Describe the accident:

elements.name: MTQ8
elements.title: Was the collision caused or contributed to by negligence of the defendant?

elements.name: MTQ9
elements.title: What are you claiming?

elements.name: MTQ10
elements.title: Injuries: Choose all that apply:

choices.text: Damage for future loss of income and future earning capacity
Damages for future cost of care
Damages for loss of house maintenance capacity
Damage for past lost income and loss opportunity to earn income
General damages for pain, suffering, loss of amenities, and loss of enjoyment of life
Other relief as the judge decide is fair

elements.name: MTQE2
elements.title: Amount

elements.name: NPQ1
elements.title: Did you suffer injuries because of [the defendant]'s actions or negligence?
elements.description: This could include actions that are intentional such as hitting someone or not intentionally such as carelessly throwing a baseball into a crowd. It could also include the failure to do an action such as clean up the slip on the store floor where people are walking.

elements.name: NPQ1End
elements.title: END

elements.name: NPQ2
elements.title: On what date did the injury occur?

elements.name: NPQ3
elements.title: Where did the injury occur?

choices.text: At [defendant]'s place of work or business

elements.name: NPQ3a
elements.title: What is the exact address of the location?

elements.name: NPQ4
elements.title: Describe how the injury occurred:
elements.description: Give a short and accurate account of what happened. For example, you were walking through the store, owned by the defendant, when you slipped and fell onto your back. The fall was due to a liquid spill in the middle of the shopping aisle. There was no sign or warning to indicate there was a spill. You did not see the liquid before you fell. Due to the fall you suffered injury.

elements.name: NPQ5
elements.title: Injuries caused you:
elements.description: Pick all that apply.

choices.text: Pain, suffering, loss of amenities, and loss of enjoyment of life
Past lost income and loss of opportunity to earn income
Future loss of income and future earning capacity

elements.name: NPQ5Q1
elements.title: I'm unsure what injuries to pick.
elements.body: If you are unsure about the extent of your damages it is best if you speak to a lawyer and get legal advice. In general you may be able to claim compensation if for example the injury caused you to loss wages, incur medical expenses and caused you pain and suffering.

elements.name: NPQ5FDefine1
elements.title: Out of pocket expenses could cover any expense you had due to the injury such as medical treatment, or medications.

elements.name: NPQ6
elements.title: Please describe:

elements.name: NPQ7
elements.title: Please provide any other relevant facts you wish the court to know.

elements.name: NPQ8
elements.title: What remedy are you asking for from the courts?

elements.name: NPQ9
elements.title: What is your legal bases? (e.g. laws, specific court rules etc.)

elements.name: NPQ10
elements.title: What courthouse location are you filing this claim?

elements.name: NUQ0
elements.title: You are:

choices.text: unhappy about a service [the Defendant] promised to provide to you
unhappy with a good you bought (or was promised) from [the defendant]

elements.name: NUQ1
elements.title: Describe service [Defendant] agreed to provide:
elements.description: For example, the defendant was hired by the claimant to reroof their home.

elements.name: NUQ1Q1
elements.title: Do I need to have a written agreement?
elements.body: No, the agreement could be oral. An agreement is usually binding one there is an exchange of promises. For example Anne promise to pay the hairdresser a set amount and they promise to cut her hair, or Bob will pay the consultant $6,000 for their services consulting on a business opportunity.

elements.name: NUQ2
elements.title: When did you make an agreement for the service?

elements.name: NUQ3
elements.title: Where did you make an agreement for the service?

elements.name: NUQ4
elements.title: Did you agree upon a price for the service?

elements.name: NUQ5
elements.title: How much was that price?

elements.name: NUQ6
elements.title: Did you pay this full price to [defendant]?

elements.name: NUQ9a
elements.title: When did you pay this?

elements.name: NUQ7
elements.title: Did you partially pay [defendant]?

elements.name: NUQ9
elements.title: How much did you pay?

elements.name: NUQ11
elements.title: When did you pay this [defendant]?

elements.name: NUQ10
elements.title: How much remains to pay the [Defendant]?

elements.name: NUQ8
elements.title: Did you pay [Defendant1]?

elements.name: NUQ8a
elements.title: How much did you pay?

elements.name: NUQ8b
elements.title: When did you pay this?

elements.name: NUPanelQ12
NUQ12
elements.title: Chose which you think best describes your situation:

choices.text: The service was not according to your agreement
The service was not of quality
The defendant in performing service caused me or my property damage

elements.name: NUQ13
elements.title: Please give more detail to your selections:

elements.name: NUQ14
elements.title: Please provide any other relevant facts you wish the court to know.

elements.name: NUQ15
elements.title: What remedy are you asking for from the courts?

elements.name: NUQ16
elements.title: What is your legal bases? (e.g. laws, specific court rules etc.)

elements.name: NUQ17
elements.title: What courthouse location are you filing this claim?

elements.name: NUQ17Complete
elements.title: Complete

elements.visibleIf: ({NUQ4} = "y" and {NUQ6} = "y") or ({NUQ4} = "y" and {NUQ6} = "n" and {NUQ7} notempty) or ({NUQ4} = "n" and {NUQ8} notempty)

elements.name: NUQ18
elements.title: Describe the goods you bought from [Defendant1]:
elements.description: For example: a 2008 Toyota Yaris, or antique dining room table set that included 6 chairs.

elements.name: NUQ19
elements.title: When did you buy the goods from [Defendant1]?
elements.description: If you can't remember the exact date or it occurred on a range of dates give your best estimation.

elements.name: NUPanelQ20
NUQ20Q1
elements.title: What if I bought them online?
elements.body: If you bought them online, write the address you were to pick good up at or they were to be delivered to.

elements.name: NUQ20Store
elements.title: Store Name

elements.name: NUQ20Address
elements.title: Address
Where did you buy the goods from [Defendant1]?
elements.description: If you bought goods in a store provide the name and address of that store.

elements.name: NUQ21
elements.title: What was wrong with the goods?

choices.text: The goods did not meet the description or sample provided by the Defendant.
The goods were not reasonably fit for the purpose they were to have.
The goods did not last for a reasonable time.

elements.name: NUQ21BDefine1
elements.title: Reasonably fit - in a good enough/working condition as you would expect them to be in. For example a 20 year old car may need new parts but you expect in running condition if it was advertised as a working car.

elements.name: NUQ21CDefine1
elements.title: Reasonable time - the amount of time a person would expect this specific good to last, considering it's age and condition.

elements.name: NUQ25
elements.title: When did you discover the good did not meet the description or sample?

elements.name: NUQ30
elements.title: Please explain:

elements.name: NUQ31

elements.name: NUQ32
elements.title: Please explain:

elements.title: Provide any relevant details on what happened:

elements.name: ARQ1
elements.title: Who are you?

elements.name: ARQ1Define1
elements.title: Plaintiff is the person or entity that started the lawsuit. They are the one making the claim.

elements.name: ARQ1Define2
elements.title: The Defendant is the one being sued. They are named as the defendant on the Notice of Civil Claim.

elements.name: ARQ2
elements.title: What is your full legal name?
elements.description: For example, how it appears on your passport or government issued identification.

elements.name: Q2a
elements.title: Have you filed a document with the court already that contains your address for service?
elements.description: If you are named as a defendant or plaintiff and have filed a Notice of Civil Claim or a Response to a Notice of Civil Claim you will have likely already let the courts know at what address you can receive documents.

elements.name: ARQ2b
elements.title: What is your address for service?
elements.description: This would be an address where you can receive documents relating to this case such as court forms and notices of upcoming court dates.

elements.name: ARQ3
elements.title: You are responding to the notice of application made by...
elements.description: Write the name as it appears on the Notice of Application form.

elements.name: ARQ4
elements.title: The applicant is asking for the following orders, please indicate if you are consenting to them, opposing them, or take no position on them.

choices.text: Consent to the the granting of this order
Oppose the granting of this order
Take no position to the granting of this order

elements.name: ARQ7
elements.title: Give a brief summary of facts in support of you opposing the order(s):
elements.description: Use numbered paragraphs to organize your facts. Try to use a new paragraph for each new fact.

elements.name: ARQ8
elements.title: What laws or rules are you relying on to support your application?

elements.name: ARQ9
elements.title: Are you relying on any affidavits to support your application?

ARQ10Number
elements.title: Affidavit #

elements.name: ARQ10Name
elements.title: Name

elements.name: ARQ10Date
elements.title: Date
Please provide the following information about the `affidavit`:
elements.description: This information can usually be found on the top right hand corner of the `affidavit`.

elements.title: Are you relying on any other documents already in the court file to support your application?

elements.name: ARQ12
elements.title: Please describe this document:

elements.title: How much time do you estimate it will take you to respond to the application in court?

elements.name: AOQ1
elements.title: Who are you?
elements.description: You are the claimant if you are the one who start the lawsuit. You are the defendant if you are named as a defendant in the Notice of Claim.

elements.name: AOQ2
elements.title: What is your full legal name?
elements.description: Please include your full legal name. For example, how it appears on your passport or government issued identification.

elements.name: AOQ3
elements.title: What is your occupation?
elements.description: For example: Nurse, Carpenter, Accountant, Student, etc.

elements.name: AOQ4
elements.title: What is your address?

elements.name: AOQ5
elements.title: What is the name of the person you served?
elements.description: This is the person you gave or sent the documents to.

elements.name: AOQ5Define
elements.title: To serve documents means getting documents from one person to another. There are specific rules on how to give certain court forms to other parties in a lawsuit. Check the Court Rules or seek legal advice if you are unsure how to serve your documents.

elements.name: AOQ5Q1
elements.title: Where can I learn more about serving court forms?
elements.body: For guidance on how to serve court documents see the Supreme Court Civil Guide Starting an Action by Notice of Civil Claim (https://www.supremecourtbc.ca/sites/default/files/web/Starting-an-Action-by-Notice-of-Civil-Claim.pdf

elements.name: AOQ10Q1
elements.title: How do I know if it was ordinary mail or not?
elements.body: If you sent it through registered mail select "no", otherwise you probably sent it via ordinary mail.

elements.description: Please provide the method of service and the exact location of where they were served. If you have a court order allowing for alternative service please provide details. For example:

elements.name: AOQ15

elements.name: AFQ0Note1
elements.title:
An `affidavit` is one of the ways you will tell your story to the court. A judge may also ask you to tell your story, under oath, in court. 

In your `affidavit`, tell your story in your own words. Include all the facts that you think the judge may need. Everything you say must to be true to the best of your knowledge. 

You can include information that you got from someone else, but you must include who told you, when they told you and that you believe what they said is true. For example, you can include information that your child has told you. 

Click here to get tips for writing your `affidavit`. (https://www.supremecourtbc.ca/sites/default/files/web/A-Guide-to-Preparing-Your-Affidavit.pdf)

elements.name: AFQ1
elements.title: Who are you?
elements.description: You are the plaintiff if you are the one who start the lawsuit. You are the defendant if you are being sued and are named as a defendant in the Notice of Civil Claim.

elements.name: AFQ2
elements.title: What is your full legal name?
elements.description: Please include your full legal name. For example, how it appears on your passport or government issued identification.

elements.name: AFQ3
elements.title: What is your job or occupation?
elements.description: For example: Nurse, Carpenter, Accountant, Student, etc.

elements.name: AFQ4
elements.title: What is your address?

elements.name: AFQ5
elements.title: How many 'affidavits' have you written before this one for this case?
elements.description: If you have already written 2 'affidavits' before this one you should select #3.

elements.name: AFQ6
elements.title: Do you have personal knowledge of the information and facts that you are putting in this `affidavit`?

elements.name: AFQ6E1
elements.title: Sorry, but to proceed you must have personal knowledge of the information and facts within your `affidavit`.

elements.name: AFQ7
elements.title: Describe your relationship with the other party(ies) in the lawsuit.

elements.name: AFQ8
elements.title: Describe your evidence (what you heard or saw first hand):
elements.description: Stick to one issue or fact per paragraph. To add another paragraph simply press "add paragraph".

elements.name: AFP1
elements.title: PRESENT PREVIEW

elements.name: AFQ9
elements.title: You have read over your statement and swear or affirm it to be true to the best of your knowledge?

choices.text: I'd like to go back and edit it

elements.name: AFQ9Q1
elements.title: I'd like to attach a document how do I do that?
elements.body:
"If you want to support a fact in your `affidavit` with a document, you must refer to it in your `affidavit` as an exhibit. Each exhibit should be given a letter and referred to in alphabetical order. The first exhibit you refer to in the `affidavit` will be lettered ‘A'. For example: As of July 12, 2015, I have $30,000 in my TD bank account. Attached to this, my `affidavit` as Exhibit A, is a true copy of my TD bank 

Attach all your exhibits at the end of your `affidavit`. If your exhibit has multiple pages, number the pages."

elements.name: AFComplete
elements.title: Complete

elements.name: NAQ3
elements.title: Name all the people or parties affected by this application
elements.description: This usually includes the defendant and plaintiff and the person the order relates to. For example if you are seeking an order for the plaintiff's medical records held by Dr. Smith, you would want to name both the plaintiff and Dr. Smith.

elements.name: RCQ3
elements.title: Please verify this is your address [defendant's address], email, and fax where you can receive court documents

elements.name: RCQ4A
elements.title: What is the address where you can receive court documents?

elements.name: RCQ4B
elements.title: Contact information

elements.name: RCQ4Q1
elements.title: Do I need to provide my home address?
elements.body: No, the address does not need to be to your home, so long as you are able to receive documents at the address provided. For example, it can be a work address.

elements.name: RCPanelQ5

choices.text: This is outside of my knowledge

elements.title: The following are statements made in the Notice of Civil Claim. Please indicate if you admit, or deny these statements or that they are outside of your knowledge.

elements.name: RCQ6
elements.title: Your version of facts: In numbered paragraphs please provide an explanation of why you are denying any of the statements of facts made in the Notice of Civil Claim
elements.description: This is where you can set out your version of the facts. For example if you denied the Plaintiff's statement "You agreed to install the kitchen plumbing by June 15th 2018."  You would write "On June 1st 2018, you informed the Plaintiff the kitchen plumbing would be installed by June 30th 2018. The Plaintiff agree to this timeline."

elements.name: RCQ7
elements.title: Additional Facts: In numbered paragraphs please explain any additional facts that are relevant to this case.

elements.name: RCPanelQ8
RCQ9
elements.title: What legal basis you are using to oppose the claim?
elements.description: Specify any rules, laws or legal principles you are relying on. Use a new entry for each legal basis.

elements.name: RCComplete
elements.title: Complete
The following relief is sought by [defendant]. Please indicate what position you are taking on the granting of each relief.
